Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate plants that have enough water and light, showing them as healthy and growing.
The student can illustrate plants lacking water, depicting them as wilted or not growing well.
The student can illustrate plants that are without light, showing them as unable to grow properly.
The student can use their drawings to show how patterns in plant growth are affected by water and light, demonstrating understanding that plants need both to live and grow.
